task_overview: Compare eBOSS DR14 P(k) observations with LCDM, wCDM, and LCDM+massive neutrinos models, then run MCMC posterior analysis on neutrino model parameters.

observational_data.description: Matter power spectrum P(k) measurements from SDSS-IV eBOSS Data Release 14
observational_data.expected_columns: Likely k [h/Mpc], P(k) [Mpc/h]^3, and errors. Inspect file header to confirm.
observational_data.redshift_range: Effective redshift around z~1.5 for quasar sample

LCDM.description: Standard Lambda-CDM with massless neutrinos (or minimal 0.06 eV)

wCDM.description: Dark energy with constant equation of state w ≠ -1
wCDM.notes: w0=-0.9 chosen to show visible deviation from LCDM. Planck+BAO+SNe finds w0=-1.03±0.03.

LCDM_massive_neutrinos.description: LCDM with massive neutrinos as free parameters
LCDM_massive_neutrinos.notes: m_nu=0.15 eV chosen to show visible suppression vs LCDM. Planck upper limit is 0.12 eV at 95%.

MCMC_configuration.likelihood: Gaussian chi-squared using observed P(k) with measurement errors
MCMC_configuration.boltzmann_code: CLASS or CAMB for computing theoretical P(k)

neutrino_suppression.description: Massive neutrinos suppress the matter power spectrum on small scales (high k) due to free-streaming
neutrino_suppression.approximate_formula: Delta P/P ≈ -8 * f_nu, where f_nu = Omega_nu/Omega_m
neutrino_suppression.scale_dependence: Suppression becomes significant for k > k_fs where k_fs ~ 0.018 * Omega_m^(1/2) * (m_nu/1eV)^(1/2) h/Mpc

wCDM_effect.description: w > -1 leads to less acceleration, different growth history, modifying P(k) amplitude and shape
wCDM_effect.effect: Changes the growth factor D(a) and hence overall normalization and mild shape change in P(k)

plot1.title: P(k) Comparison: eBOSS DR14 vs Models
